title: The Bookkeeper of Angelwing Home
body:
This post is part of an ongoing series: Part II

It’s funny how everything can change in the blink of an eye, last month the world was relieved with the peace talks between two of the largest warmongers, and now the once lush and green hills have become a hellscape of ash and misery.

In one of my days taking care of the children in Angelwing home, I tried to collect more information about how the world was before, to try and teach the remaining children the beauty and story of Old World, so they could keep the tradition and dont repeat the same mistakes as we did.

After the cleanup of Newark nest, I could recover a few books and diaries of what seemed to be the once residents of the region, this is one of such diaries and while mostly covered in gore, someone has to try and salvage the most of information from it.

The diary reads as it follows:

Au ust 2 20

“I was a journalist, working on a story about how the sixty years-old bomb shelters from the cold war were assimilated into modern homes, creating a leisure space for the middle and upper class families, at the time it seemed like a waste, but now I just wish that i wasnt there when it all went down.”

gust 25 19

“Nobody knew for sure what was happening, the trails in the sky heading towards the major cities could be any number of things, so the people just went on with their day, leaving just a lucky few”

The rest of this page is torn, cant know why for sure, but maybe it was just a dumb theory of what happened, it doesnt do much good to waste time thinking on anything else than surviving.

A s 26 9

“Two days have passed since that day but i still cant sleep, the cries of agony and intense heat that followed the impact left me and the crew paralized, there wasnt much we could do anyways, with no supplies or training and stuck into the house’s basement.”

A

“Mike was a war movie aficionado, and told us that we were on a pocket created by the special material used in the walls, and the debris that closed us off from the rest of the world, and it should protect us from the worst effect from whatever was happening topside.”

After this entry, most of the dates and entries are illegible, I tried the best i can to salvage some excerpts but i guess the owner’s fate wasnt as good as i hoped

“We were five people, Me, Mike, Mr. Brown, his wife and daughter, with no tools to remove the wood and concrete that separated us from the outside world, but at least we had enough food to last for a few weeks since the pantry was filled a few days earlier.”

“The work was tough, with splinters and rocks tearing against our skin, you see, in our line of work you dont get to do much physical work, so when you have to remove meters of rubble with your bare hands, you may end up losing more blood than most people imagine that they have in their body.”

“Even in those conditions, we couldnt stop, specially as we went closer and closer to the streets, and the smell of rotting flesh and burning paper hit our nostrils, that faced us with and important decision: starve inside, or seek new supplies and find out what was happened.”

“For better or for worse, the decision was made for us, in the dead of the night we started hearing scraping and clicking noises from outside, like some wild animal was searching the rubble to try and find its next meal, but that animal didnt sound like anything I have seen before.”

“What was our prision a day ago, was keeping us safe from whatever was trying to get in, as the night went on, more and more kept coming, possibly attracted by the leader of the pack, that clicked incessantly, as if barking orders to the others.”

“The time of the attack was nigh, a few planks of wood was the only form of weapon we could muster to fight agains the incoming horde, but even so, we hoped that someone could come and rescue us “

This is the last entry in the diary, hopefully i wont meet such end,I just can’t let go, not for me, but for all the kids in the Orphanage, specially after scavenging most of the region only to find out that no living humans inhabit this place

Our survival chances are slim, but i’m not gonna lie down and wait to be killed by some freak, tomorrow i’m going to try and make contact via radio again, I’m sure that someone, somewhere is finding a way to solve this mess.
author: donger1no
